meta.article_title: November 9, 2015 - Sidespin Serves that Break Away Tend to Be More Effective

sidespin-break-away-more-effective.probleme: Sidespin serves breaking away from receivers

debutant.description: A backhand sidespin serve tends to be more effective to an opponent's forehand, while a forehand pendulum serve tends to be more effective to the backhand.
This is both because players often have to lunge after the ball as it breaks away, and because the racket angle needed to return these sidespins is less natural when done this way.

intermediaire.nom: Big breaking sidespin serve (backhand) to backhand
intermediaire.description: This is very difficult for many receivers to handle as they often don't have as much range on the backhand as the forehand, and so end up reaching for the ball as it breaks away.

intermediaire.nom: Big breaking sidespin serve (forehand) to forehand
intermediaire.description: This serve is extremely effective through the intermediate level, but doesn't work very well at the higher levels, where they just loop it.

avance.nom: Short sidespin serve (middle or forehand) to wide forehand
avance.description: This is usually done with a tomahawk, backhand, or reverse pendulum serve.

avance.nom: Short sidespin serve (backhand) to wide backhand
avance.description: This is usually done with a forehand pendulum serve.

exercices_complementaires.description: Try out each combination and see what happens.
